channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Learning Depth from Focus in the Wild
item.description: In addition, for the generalization of the proposed network, we develop a simulator to realistically reproduce the features of commercial cameras, such as changes in field of view, focal length and principal points.

item.title: Successor Representation Active Inference
item.description: Recent work has uncovered close links between between classical reinforcement learning algorithms, Bayesian filtering, and Active Inference which lets us understand value functions in terms of Bayesian posteriors.

item.title: 3D Clothed Human Reconstruction in the Wild
item.description: Although much progress has been made in 3D clothed human reconstruction, most of the existing methods fail to produce robust results from in-the-wild images, which contain diverse human poses and appearances.

item.title: On the Versatile Uses of Partial Distance Correlation in Deep Learning
item.description: Comparing the functional behavior of neural network models, whether it is a single network over time or two (or more networks) during or post-training, is an essential step in understanding what they are learning (and what they are not), and for identifying strategies for regularization or efficiency improvements.

item.title: Uncertainty Inspired Underwater Image Enhancement
item.description: After that, we adopt a consensus process to predict a deterministic result based on a set of samples from the distribution.

item.title: Learning Topological Interactions for Multi-Class Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel topological interaction module to encode the topological interactions into a deep neural network.

item.title: Explaining Deepfake Detection by Analysing Image Matching
item.description: Besides the supervision of binary labels, deepfake detection models implicitly learn artifact-relevant visual concepts through the FST-Matching (i. e. the matching fake, source, target images) in the training set.

item.title: Efficient Meta-Tuning for Content-aware Neural Video Delivery
item.description: Our method significantly reduces the computational cost and achieves even better performance, paving the way for applying neural video delivery techniques to practical applications.

item.title: Object-Compositional Neural Implicit Surfaces
item.description: This paper proposes a novel framework, ObjectSDF, to build an object-compositional neural implicit representation with high fidelity in 3D reconstruction and object representation.

item.title: Locality Guidance for Improving Vision Transformers on Tiny Datasets
item.description: Therefore, our locality guidance approach is very simple and efficient, and can serve as a basic performance enhancement method for VTs on tiny datasets.

item.title: DC-BENCH: Dataset Condensation Benchmark
item.description: Dataset Condensation is a newly emerging technique aiming at learning a tiny dataset that captures the rich information encoded in the original dataset.

item.title: CoSMix: Compositional Semantic Mix for Domain Adaptation in 3D LiDAR Segmentation
item.description: We propose a new approach of sample mixing for point cloud UDA, namely Compositional Semantic Mix (CoSMix), the first UDA approach for point cloud segmentation based on sample mixing.

item.title: Hierarchically Self-Supervised Transformer for Human Skeleton Representation Learning
item.description: Despite the success of fully-supervised human skeleton sequence modeling, utilizing self-supervised pre-training for skeleton sequence representation learning has been an active field because acquiring task-specific skeleton annotations at large scales is difficult.

item.title: Integrating Linguistic Theory and Neural Language Models
item.description: This has led many to question the relevance of linguistics for modern natural language processing.

item.title: Explicit Image Caption Editing
item.description: Given an image and a reference caption, the image caption editing task aims to correct the misalignment errors and generate a refined caption.

item.title: Monocular 3D Object Reconstruction with GAN Inversion
item.description: Reconstruction is achieved by searching for a latent space in the 3D GAN that best resembles the target mesh in accordance with the single view observation.

item.title: Overlooked factors in concept-based explanations: Dataset choice, concept salience, and human capability
item.description: Second, we find that concepts in the probe dataset are often less salient and harder to learn than the classes they claim to explain, calling into question the correctness of the explanations.

item.title: Perspective Phase Angle Model for Polarimetric 3D Reconstruction
item.description: Current polarimetric 3D reconstruction methods, including those in the well-established shape from polarization literature, are all developed under the orthographic projection assumption.

item.title: Towards Efficient and Scale-Robust Ultra-High-Definition Image Demoireing
item.description: With the rapid development of mobile devices, modern widely-used mobile phones typically allow users to capture 4K resolution (i. e., ultra-high-definition) images.

item.title: DecoupleNet: Decoupled Network for Domain Adaptive Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Unsupervised domain adaptation in semantic segmentation has been raised to alleviate the reliance on expensive pixel-wise annotations.

item.title: Densely Constrained Depth Estimator for Monocular 3D Object Detection
item.description: So these methods only use a small number of projection constraints and produce insufficient depth candidates, leading to inaccurate depth estimation.

item.title: MANI-Rank: Multiple Attribute and Intersectional Group Fairness for Consensus Ranking
item.description: This is an extended version of "MANI-Rank: Multiple Attribute and Intersectional Group Fairness for Consensus Ranking", to appear in ICDE 2022.

item.title: Tailoring Self-Supervision for Supervised Learning
item.description: Our exhaustive experiments validate the merits of LoRot as a pretext task tailored for supervised learning in terms of robustness and generalization capability.

item.title: Introducing Auxiliary Text Query-modifier to Content-based Audio Retrieval
item.description: While the range of conventional content-based audio retrieval is limited to audio that is similar to the query audio, the proposed method can adjust the retrieval range by adding an embedding of the auxiliary text query-modifier to the embedding of the query sample audio in a shared latent space.

item.title: EleGANt: Exquisite and Locally Editable GAN for Makeup Transfer
item.description: Most existing methods view makeup transfer as transferring color distributions of different facial regions and ignore details such as eye shadows and blushes.

item.title: Difficulty-Aware Simulator for Open Set Recognition
item.description: Furthermore, moderate- and easy-difficulty samples are also yielded by our modified GAN and Copycat, respectively.

item.title: Fully Sparse 3D Object Detection
item.description: To enable efficient long-range LiDAR-based object detection, we build a fully sparse 3D object detector (FSD).

item.title: Learning Pedestrian Group Representations for Multi-modal Trajectory Prediction
item.description: A key idea of GP-Graph is to model both individual-wise and group-wise relations as graph representations.

item.title: GRIT: Faster and Better Image captioning Transformer Using Dual Visual Features
item.description: Current state-of-the-art methods for image captioning employ region-based features, as they provide object-level information that is essential to describe the content of images; they are usually extracted by an object detector such as Faster R-CNN.

item.title: Quantized Training of Gradient Boosting Decision Trees
item.description: Recent years have witnessed significant success in Gradient Boosting Decision Trees (GBDT) for a wide range of machine learning applications.

item.title: AU-Supervised Convolutional Vision Transformers for Synthetic Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: In Learing from Synthetic Data(LSD) task, facial expression recognition (FER) methods aim to learn the representation of expression from the artificially generated data and generalise to real data.

item.title: Multimodal Transformer for Automatic 3D Annotation and Object Detection
item.description: By enriching the sparse point clouds, our method achieves 4. 48\% and 4. 03\% better 3D AP on KITTI moderate and hard samples, respectively, versus the state-of-the-art autolabeler.

item.title: Learning Sequence Representations by Non-local Recurrent Neural Memory
item.description: The key challenge of sequence representation learning is to capture the long-range temporal dependencies.

item.title: Differentiable Agent-based Epidemiology
item.description: Agent-based models (ABMs) are an increasingly popular alternative paradigm that can represent the heterogeneity of contact interactions with granular detail and agency of individual behavior.

item.title: GIPSO: Geometrically Informed Propagation for Online Adaptation in 3D LiDAR Segmentation
item.description: Our experiments show the effectiveness of our segmentation approach on thousands of real-world point clouds.

item.title: Temporal and cross-modal attention for audio-visual zero-shot learning
item.description: We show that our proposed framework that ingests temporal features yields state-of-the-art performance on the \ucf, \vgg, and \activity benchmarks for (generalised) zero-shot learning.

item.title: The Anatomy of Video Editing: A Dataset and Benchmark Suite for AI-Assisted Video Editing
item.description: Machine learning is transforming the video editing industry.

item.title: UniHPF : Universal Healthcare Predictive Framework with Zero Domain Knowledge
item.description: Experimental results demonstrate that UniHPF is capable of building large-scale EHR models that can process any form of medical data from distinct EHR systems.

item.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Market Making Under a Hawkes Process-Based Limit Order Book Model
item.description: The stochastic control problem of optimal market making is among the central problems in quantitative finance.

item.title: AiATrack: Attention in Attention for Transformer Visual Tracking
item.description: However, the independent correlation computation in the attention mechanism could result in noisy and ambiguous attention weights, which inhibits further performance improvement.

item.title: Discover and Mitigate Unknown Biases with Debiasing Alternate Networks
item.description: By training in an alternate manner, the discoverer tries to find multiple unknown biases of the classifier without any annotations of biases, and the classifier aims at unlearning the biases identified by the discoverer.

item.title: Exploration of Parameter Spaces Assisted by Machine Learning
item.description: We showcase a variety of functions and classes that implement sampling procedures with improved exploration of the parameter space assisted by machine learning.

item.title: Streamable Neural Fields
item.description: Neural fields have emerged as a new data representation paradigm and have shown remarkable success in various signal representations.

item.title: VirtualPose: Learning Generalizable 3D Human Pose Models from Virtual Data
item.description: While monocular 3D pose estimation seems to have achieved very accurate results on the public datasets, their generalization ability is largely overlooked.

item.title: Interpreting Latent Spaces of Generative Models for Medical Images using Unsupervised Methods
item.description: The results show that unsupervised methods to discover interpretable directions in GANs generalize to VAEs and can be applied to medical images.

item.title: Probable Domain Generalization via Quantile Risk Minimization
item.description: To realize this, we explicitly relate training and test domains as draws from the same underlying meta-distribution, and propose a new optimization problem -- Quantile Risk Minimization (QRM) -- which requires that predictors generalize with high probability.

item.title: Overcoming Shortcut Learning in a Target Domain by Generalizing Basic Visual Factors from a Source Domain
item.description: Our approach extends the training set with an additional dataset (the source domain), which is specifically designed to facilitate learning independent representations of basic visual factors.

item.title: Pretraining a Neural Network before Knowing Its Architecture
item.description: A recently released Graph HyperNetwork (GHN) trained this way on one million smaller ImageNet architectures is able to predict parameters for large unseen networks such as ResNet-50.

item.title: RV4JaCa -- Runtime Verification for Multi-Agent Systems
item.description: This paper presents a Runtime Verification (RV) approach for Multi-Agent Systems (MAS) using the JaCaMo framework.

item.title: Feature Representation Learning for Unsupervised Cross-domain Image Retrieval
item.description: Current supervised cross-domain image retrieval methods can achieve excellent performance.
